required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Wearable Robotic Assistance on Gait
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Wearable Robotic Assistance on Gait Mechanics and Energetics in Individuals With Neurological Impairment

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The overarching goal of this study is to improve mobility in individuals with movement disorders through advances in wearable assistance (i.e. powered orthoses).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Feasibility assessment of powered orthosis assistance and resistance during walking.

primary_outcome.measure: The metabolic energy required to walk
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Metabolic energy required to walk will be measured using a portable metabolic measurement system (Cosmed K5). Units: J/kg/m

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Walking speed measured over-ground or on a treadmill. Units: m/s

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Muscle activity during walking will be measured using electromyography electrodes. Units: mV

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: A motion capture system will be used to measure the posture of the body during walking. Units: Degrees

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: A motion capture system and force plates will be used to measure the forces produced by the muscles of the body during walking. Units: Nm

primary_outcome.measure: Change in energy required to walk
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: We will compare the metabolic energy required to walk. Units: % change

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: We will compare the distance covered in 6 minutes of walking. Units: % change

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: We will compare the muscle activity profile. Units: % change

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 8 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of steps per minute will be measured. Units: steps/min

arm_group.description: Walking with exoskeleton assistance to make walking easier.
Walking with exoskeleton resistance for functional gait training.

intervention.description: Novel powered leg brace to provide assistance during walking.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 5 and 75 years old, inclusive.
- Either a healthy volunteer or a diagnosis of a neurologically-based walking disorder due to stroke, spinal cord injury, Parkinson's disease, or cerebral palsy.
- Must be able to understand and follow simple directions based on parent report and clinical observation during the history and physical examination.
- Able to provide verbal assent, if appropriate. If the participant is non-verbal, parental interpretation of gesticulation for assent will be used.
- The ability to read and understand English.
- Able to walk at least 30 feet with or without a walking aid (GMFCS Level I-III for individuals with cerebral palsy)
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Any neurological, musculoskeletal or cardiorespiratory injury, health condition ( including pregnancy), or diagnosis other than stroke, spinal cord injury, Parkinson's disease or cerebral palsy that would affect the ability to walk as directed for short periods of time.
